line_1: The essence of the rose exhale,
line_2: For this, may ev'ry wand'ring gale

line_1: And Orange-flow'rs their od'rous Breath exhale,
line_2: There choice Perfumes shall give a pleasing Gale,

line_1: From every leaf salubrious dews exhale,
line_2: And pure elixirs breathe in every balmy gale.

line_1: No scent more fragrant does the rose exhale,
line_2: Then those which fan'd the sweet ambrosial gale.

line_1: Such as Arabia's spicy groves exhale,
line_2: Ambrosial scents the ravish'd smell regale;

line_1: Their souls in fragrant dews exhale,
line_2: And breathe fresh life in every gale.

line_1: Hope springs aloft, the mists of Grief exhale,
line_2: And Life and Joy renew their course — all hail!

line_1: Their souls in fragrant dews exhale,
line_2: And breathe fresh life in every gale.

line_1: What cheering scents those bord'ring banks exhale!
line_2: How loud that heifer lows from yonder vale!
And various Colours paint the Vale;

line_1: What Odours do these op'ning Buds exhale,
line_2: Yet cannot o'er thy greater Sweets prevail,

line_1: What Odours do these op'ning Buds exhale,
line_2: Or their enchanting Beauties thine excell.

line_1: Till fields and shades their sweets exhale,
line_2: And music swell each opening gale:

line_1: Nor let a breeze its heaving breath exhale,
line_2: While others check each ruder gale,

line_1: Nor let th' imprison'd Essences exhale,
line_2: To save the Powder from too rude a Gale,
And roses more perfum'd the gale.
